Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Typo Fix in EnumFields.xml" (#2311) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Some binding template file contains invalid closing tag.
These tags are in comment-out filed, so this PR will not affect other codes.

The fundamental solution is to fix following file, but I do not have access to repository that contains that file...

```
# ~/Projects/github.com/yamachu/xamarin-android $ [typo/android-binding-enum-mapping]
cat /Applications/Visual\ Studio.app/Contents/Resources/lib/monodevelop/AddIns/MonoDevelop.MonoDroid/templates/Project/BindingProject/EnumFields.xml
<enum-field-mappings>
  <!--
  This example converts the constants Fragment_id, Fragment_name,
  and Fragment_tag from android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity.FragmentTag
  to an enum called Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTagType with values
  Id, Name, and Tag.

  <mapping clr-enum-type="Android.Support.V4.App.FragmentTagType" jni-class="android/support/v4/app/FragmentActivity$FragmentTag">
    <field clr-name="Id" jni-name="Fragment_id" value="1" />
    <field clr-name="Name" jni-name="Fragment_name" value="0" />
    <field clr-name="Tag" jni-name="Fragment_tag" value="2" />
  </type>

  Notes:
  - An optional "bitfield" attribute marks the enum type with [Flags].
  - For Java interfaces, use "jni-interface" attribute instead of "jni-class" attribute.
  -->
</enum-field-mappings>
%
```

Although the format of following files are different from the current one, the closing tag is correct so I did not modify it.
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/tests/CodeGen-Binding/Xamarin.Android.LibraryProjectZip-LibBinding/Transforms/EnumFields.xml
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/tests/CodeGen-Binding/Xamarin.Android.McwGen-Tests/Transforms/EnumFields.xml

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] error MSB4018: The "ResolveLibraryProjectImports" task failed unexpectedly while building Android App" (#2251) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/626304

If `ResolveLibraryProjectImports` encounters a corrupt zip or
aar file during the extraction process we get the following
error.

	Xamarin.Tools.Zip.ZipIOException: Unexpected libzip error: EOF
	  at Xamarin.Tools.Zip.ZipArchive.Open (System.String path, System.IO.FileMode mode, System.String defaultExtractionDir, System.Boolean strictConsistencyChecks, Xamarin.Tools.Zip.IPlatformOptions options) [0x00141] in <9421129374314790afd60f8c0021d3d4>:0
	  at Xamarin.Android.Tools.Files.ReadZipFile (System.String filename, System.Boolean strictConsistencyChecks) [0x00000] in <c304dcc9c82e4174bfeded58a523ee7b>:0
	  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.MonoAndroidHelper.ReadZipFile (System.String filename) [0x00000] in <c304dcc9c82e4174bfeded58a523ee7b>:0
	  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.ResolveLibraryProjectImports.Extract (Java.Interop.Tools.Cecil.DirectoryAssemblyResolver res, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1[T] jars, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1[T] resolvedResourceDirectories, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1[T] resolvedAssetDirectories, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1[T] resolvedEnvironments) [0x00521] in <c304dcc9c82e4174bfeded58a523ee7b>:0
	  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.ResolveLibraryProjectImports.Execute () [0x000fc] in <c304dcc9c82e4174bfeded58a523ee7b>:0
	  at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute () [0x00023] in /_/src/Build/BackEnd/TaskExecutionHost/TaskExecutionHost.cs:631
	  at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder+<ExecuteInstantiatedTask>d__26.MoveNext () [0x00212] in /_/src/Build/BackEnd/Components/RequestBuilder/TaskBuilder.cs:787  (MSB4018)

Which is not helpful at all. This commit introduces a new error
`xa1004` which at leasts reports the file that had the problem.
It also recommends that the user remove the offending file and
try a `ReBuild`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2018-06@226e91a0" (#2294) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: f970cd50d2c19dcb4b62cc1dd1198c31cc10a2df
Context: 84952df685e0ab49c82df804b306bf53fe6e0610

Commit f970cd50 included a mono bump, and subsequently broke the
build, causing it to be reverted in 84952df6.

A question: *which part* of f970cd50 is the problem: the changes to
xamarin-android, or the mono bump *itself*?

Bump mono to verify that the mono bump itself still builds.

Mono bump contains various "mono sdks" archive fixes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2018-06@46b723d6" (#2298) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: f970cd50d2c19dcb4b62cc1dd1198c31cc10a2df
Context: 84952df685e0ab49c82df804b306bf53fe6e0610

Commit f970cd50 included a mono bump, and subsequently broke the
build, causing it to be reverted in 84952df6.

A question: *which part* of f970cd50 is the problem: the changes to
xamarin-android, or the mono bump *itself*?

This question was answered by PR #2294:
[the mono bump broke things][0]:

	  cd …/xamarin-android/external/mono/mcs && make NO_DIR_CHECK=1 PROFILES='' test-profiles
	  build/rules.make:91: build/platforms/.make: No such file or directory
	  make[2]: *** No rule to make target `build/platforms/.make'.  Stop.
	  make[1]: *** [mcs-do-test-profiles] Error 2
	…/xamarin-android/src/mono-runtimes/mono-runtimes.targets(292,5): error MSB3073: The command "make DISABLE_IOS=1 -j4 -C android-host-Darwin-debug -C runtime test" exited with code 2.

@EgorBo [found][1] that in his local testing, mono/mono/2018-06@46b723
didn't fail to build quickly -- it's still building for him -- while
mono/mono/2018-06@2343f267 failed to build after just a few minutes.

Bump to mono/mono/2018-06@4289 and try to duplicate @EgorBo's results.

Additionally, mono/mono/2018-06@46b723d6 "split out" the BCL build
from the "host" build, meaning xamarin-android now needs to invoke
`make package-android-bcl` in order to build the BCL assemblies.
Update `src/mono-runtimes` accordingly.

Mono bump itself contains various "mono sdks" archive fixes.

[0]: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/job/xamarin-android-pr-builder/4289/
[1]: https://xamarinhq.slack.com/archives/C03CEGRUW/p1539628170000100

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Build] Gather and store build info for GIT submodules" (#2314) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Both `Visual Studio for Mac` and `Visual Studio for Windows` have a way to
gather information about the installed components/extensions, their versions,
commit hashes etc. Until now this information hasn't included versions of the
Xamarin.Android submodules (especially Mono) and such information is very useful
for developers so that they can see at a glance what version of Mono (or any
other bundled product) a given `Xamarin.Android` release contains. Currently all
we see is the XA release version and discovering what are the versions, branches
and commit hashes of the other components one needs to go to the release notes
first and then work their way from there. This is both unnecessary and time
consuming.

This commit aims to remedy that by gathering the following information about
each GIT submodule we're interested in:

  * Organization
  * Repository
  * Branch
  * GIT commit hash

The information is gathered in the
src/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks/Xamarin.Android.BuildInfo.props file which is
installed with Xamarin.Android and placed in
`$prefix/xamarin.android/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/`.

The file uses a hard-coded collection of properties, one per each submodule we
want to have the information on and the property value follows the format shown
below:

    SUBMODULE_NAME:ORGANIZATION/REPOSITORY/BRANCH@COMMIT

and looks similar to:

    <Project xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
      <PropertyGroup>
        <SubmoduleMonoVersion>Mono:@MONO_COMMIT@</SubmoduleMonoVersion>
        <SubmoduleJavaInteropVersion>Java.Interop:@JAVA_INTEROP_COMMIT@</SubmoduleJavaInteropVersion>
        <SubmoduleLibZipSharpVersion>LibZipSharp:@LIBZIPSHARP_COMMIT@</SubmoduleLibZipSharpVersion>
        <SubmoduleLibZipVersion>LibZip:@LIBZIP_COMMIT@</SubmoduleLibZipVersion>
        <SubmoduleMxeVersion>MXE:@MXE_COMMIT@</SubmoduleMxeVersion>
        <SubmoduleProguardVersion>ProGuard:@PROGUARD_COMMIT@</SubmoduleProguardVersion>
        <SubmoduleSqliteVersion>SQLite:@SQLITE_COMMIT@</SubmoduleSqliteVersion>
        <SubmoduleXamarinAndroidToolsVersion>Xamarin.Android Tools:@XAMARIN_ANDROID_TOOLS_COMMIT@</SubmoduleXamarinAndroidToolsVersion>
      </PropertyGroup>
    </Project>

The file is imported by `Xamarin.Android.Common.props` and thus by
`Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks.targets`, making the information available to every
Xamarin.Android project, if necessary.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[monodroid] Release local refs earlier" (#2312) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Should fix https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2257

We should release local ref earlier in these cases, because with
higher number of assemblies we can overflow the local reference table
soon enough, before returning from native code.

In case of apks it is not as much probable, but why not release it and
not take a chance.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Lots of external assembly references - JNI ERROR (app bug): local reference table overflow (max=512)" (#2257) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  create a Xamarin.Forms project which has many references to external assemblies e.g. more than 300 references.
2.  Compile and try to run such APK on Android device

Our solution has 313 references 

We noticed if we delete around 14 random references, e.g. App has less than 300 references, App starts OK.

### Expected Behavior

Run normal

### Actual Behavior

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Thai language crashes custom renderer inheriting from TimePickerRenderer" (#3620) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
We override TimePickerRenderer on Android to enable 24-hour time picking.  This works on most devices but crashes on Thai.

The error is a common one experienced by many developers (with many threads about fixing similar issues, e.g. https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/42899/datetime-tostring-throws-argumentoutofrangeexception-in-thai-locale)

The error seems to be in:
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/5787584c86f2ca44915ecaf0e690789cb7922834/Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android/Renderers/TimePickerRenderer.cs#L138 The ToString() should include a "CultureInfo.InvariantCulture" argument.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Make a Time picker renderer overload in XF 
2. Set language to Thai
3. load the app

### Expected Behavior
Don't crash.

### Actual Behavior
Crash

### Screenshots

https://us.v-cdn.net/5019960/uploads/editor/m6/5ozwodcv067k.png

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Enhancement] Horizontal ListView" (#1727) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Rationale

ListView control currently can only flow items vertically. This will add the ability to flow the items horizontally.

## Implementation

```csharp
public enum ListViewOrientation
	{
		Vertical,
		Horizontal
	}

public static readonly BindableProperty OrientationProperty = BindableProperty.Create(nameof(Orientation), typeof(ListViewOrientation), typeof(ListView), ListViewOrientation.Vertical,
			propertyChanged: (bindable, oldvalue, newvalue) => ((ListView)bindable).InvalidateLayout());

```


## Expected Result

### Android
- `ListView.Orientation`:  should indicate the directions items flow

### iOS
See Android

### UWP
See Android

## Implications for CSS
## Backward Compatibility
If not specified just ensure that no behavior changes and that items by default flow vertically

## Difficulty : Medium

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Tizen] Fix Window alpha update timing" (#4119) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
This PR change Window Alpha value update timing. because previous timing too early to update by Application code easily

### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->
None

### API Changes ###
<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 Removed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 -->
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Tizen

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
<!-- Describe any changes that may change how a user's app behaves or appears when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
<!-- If possible, take a screenshot of your test case before these changes were made and another screenshot after the changes were made to show possible visual changes. -->

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
<!-- Please list the steps that should be taken to properly test these changes on each relevant platform. If you were unable to test these changes yourself on any or all platforms, please let us know. Also, if you are able to attach a video of your test run, you will be our personal hero. -->

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] Review Android platform for Restrictions on non-SDK interfaces " (#4118) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
https://developer.android.com/about/versions/pie/restrictions-non-sdk-interfaces
Customers reported some issues with using APIs via reflection. 

On a quick look through our control gallery runs I didn't see anything more sever then grey listed items but those would probably still be good to address

Some examples are

```
W/dControlGaller( 7997): Accessing hidden field Landroid/view/WindowManagerImpl;->mGlobal:Landroid/view/WindowManagerGlobal; (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller( 7997): Accessing hidden field Landroid/view/WindowManagerGlobal;->mViews:Ljava/util/ArrayList; (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller( 7997): Accessing hidden method Landroid/view/View;->getTransitionAlpha()F (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller( 7997): Accessing hidden field Landroid/view/View;->mViewFlags:I (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller( 7997): Accessing hidden method Landroid/view/ViewGroup;->suppressLayout(Z)V (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller( 7997): Accessing hidden method Landroid/view/View;->setLeftTopRightBottom(IIII)V (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller( 8849): Accessing hidden field Ljava/nio/Buffer;->address:J (light greylist, reflection)
W/dControlGaller(12165): Accessing hidden field Landroid/view/inputmethod/InputMethodManager;->mServedView:Landroid/view/View; (light greylist, reflection)
```

### Basic Information
  - Android: 9.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[Android] Amended ScrollViewRenderer with smooth scrolling" (#4000) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Merged pull request "fix build, tentatively" (#4117) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Closed issue "Static Registrar warnings when building VSMac bundle" (#4244) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
We have a VSTS CI build that builds VSMac. As part of the build, we generate static registrars for our assemblies.

We noticed that we see these warnings during the build. We're not sure if these are OK or not.
https://gist.github.com/KirillOsenkov/bfee0d662340fa310f2d586ec9152f50


Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "WebSocketException is thrown when using ClientWebSocket ConnectAsync" (#5003) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use System.Net.WebSockets.ClientWebSocket.
2. Use ConnectAsync method to make a wss (web socket secure) connection, it throws exception.
3. Same code works in Windows 10.

### Expected Behavior
Made a wss (web socket secure) connection successfully.

### Actual Behavior
System.Net.WebSocketException is thrown.

### Environment
MacOS Sierra -- version 10.12.6

### Sample Code
```
var webSocketEndpoint = "wss://example.com";
var webSocket = new ClientWebSocket();
webSocket.ConnectAsync(new Uri(webSocketEndpoint), tokenSourceConnect.None);
```

### Debug Logs
`at System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketHandle+<ParseAndValidateConnectResponseAsync>d__30.MoveNext () [0x000fd] in /Users/{user}/WorkSpace/Xamarin/xamarin-macios/external/mono/external/corefx/src/System.Net.WebSockets.Client/src/System/Net/WebSockets/WebSocketHandle.Managed.cs:331 
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
